comments:
After installing the newest nightly build you recommend to me( see
http://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=35092#c10 ), there are two things.
The good thing is that i'm now able to see the variables when i'm debugging my
application.
The bad thing is that i've got errors after first startup of eclipse. The
messages are:

< first Box >
"Pending Configuration Changes"
Selected update will result in an invalid configuration.
</ first Box >
< second Box >
Requested operation cannot be performed because it would invalidate the current
configuration. See details for more information.

Details:
Eclipse C/C++ Development Tools(Linux GTK(1.0.1): Feature requires
plug-in"org.eclipse.cdt(1.0.1)", or combatible.
</ second Box >

I think the Null Pointer error you see is from some failed debug session.
I can Debug my Camera test Programm which is an qt application without problems.
But if i try to debug the application in which i have to do an input in the
console ( with cin << ) the debugger doesn't show the text on the console. If i
run this application i get the output on the console and i'm able to do the
input. This works fine. For more information i took a thread dump at the
follwing point. I started to debug then the Debuuger is on the first line in the
main funktion. Now i watched some variables, to see if this works and it works.
Then i press the green "Continue" button. Now there should be the output on the
console, but there is non. This was the moment where i took the the thread dump.
Here it is:
